alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 4:29PM CDT until April 22 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Scott County in east central Iowa... Southwestern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 429 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Grand Mound, or 14 miles north of Davenport, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Park View around 435 PM CDT. DeWitt, Scott County Park and Clinton County Fairgrounds around 440 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include McCausland, Malone, Low Moor and Elvira. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
